member.summary: Specifies local client security settings.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class, which is a copy or clone of the current instance.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalClientSecuritySettings.MaxClockSkew
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating.
member.returns: A that represents the maximum allowable time difference between the system clocks of the two parties that are communicating. The default is 5 minutes.
member.exception: The property is to a value less than 0.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalClientSecuritySettings.ReplayWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time that a message nonce is valid.
member.returns: A that represents the maximum time that a message nonce is valid. The default is five minutes.
member.exception: The property is to a value less than 0.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.LocalClientSecuritySettings.TimestampValidityDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum duration that the messages are valid when sent by the client. If a message is received by the service after this duration, it should discard the message.
member.returns: A that represents the maximum duration that the messages are valid when sent by the client. The default is 5 minutes.
member.exception: The property is to a value less than 0.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement
member.summary: An abstract class that, when implemented, represents a binding element that supports channel SOAP message security.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.BuildChannelFactory``1(System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext)
member.summary: Creates a channel factory based on the settings and the binding context passed in. The channel factory created is a SOAP message security channel factory, which internally has a reference to the channel factory that corresponds to the binding context, (which includes the transport channel factory).
member.returns: A channel factory based on the settings and the binding context passed in.
member.exception: A channel of type is not supported.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.BuildChannelFactoryCore``1(System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext)
member.summary: When implemented, creates a channel factory of a specified type.
member.returns: A channel factory of a specified type.
member.exception: A channel of type is not supported.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.CanBuildChannelFactory``1(System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext)
member.summary: Determines whether a channel factory of the specified type can be built.
member.returns: if a channel factory of the specified type can be built; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.CreateSecureConversationBindingElement(System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement)
member.summary: Creates a symmetric security binding element that is configured to establish a secure conversation between the client and service. The security context token issued at the end of the secure conversation handshake is used to secure the messages. The bootstrap security binding element specifies how the secure conversation handshake messages are secured.
member.param: A that contains specification on how the secure conversation handshake messages are secured.
member.returns: A object.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.CreateUserNameOverTransportBindingElement
member.summary: Creates a security binding element that is configured for client authentication based on a user name and password sent as part of the SOAP message. The binding element requires the transport to provide server authentication and message protection (for example, HTTPS).
member.returns: A object.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.EndpointSupportingTokenParameters
member.summary: Gets the endpoint that supports token parameters.
member.returns: The object that represents the endpoint that supports token parameters.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.GetProperty``1(System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext)
member.summary: Gets a specified object using the specified .
member.returns: The specified object from the or if the object is not found.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.IncludeTimestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether time stamps are included in each message.
member.returns: if time stamps are included in each message; otherwise, . The default is .

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.LocalClientSettings
member.summary: Gets the binding properties specific to local security settings used by the client.
member.returns: The that represents the binding properties specific to local security settings used by the client.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.MessageSecurityVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the message security version.
member.returns: The object that represents the message security version.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.SecurityHeaderLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the ordering of the elements in the security header for this binding.
member.returns: The that represents the ordering of the elements in the security header for this binding. The default is .
member.exception: The value is not a valid value.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.ToString
member.summary: Returns a description of this class.
member.returns: A description of the current instance.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityHeaderLayout
member.summary: Describes the layout of the security header.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityHeaderLayout.Lax
member.summary: Items are added to the security header in any order that confirms to WSS: SOAP Message security.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityHeaderLayout.Strict
member.summary: Items are added to the security header according to the general principle of "declare before use".
